==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|む|ぎょう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=むぎょう}} compound {{m|zh|無形|tr=mju heng|lit=without shape}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']], so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|むぎょう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むぎょう|hhira=むぎやう}}

# {{lb|ja|Buddhism|sort=むぎょう}}: [[formlessness]], [[bodylessness]]; something that is [[shapeless]] and [[invisible]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|む|けい|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=むぎょう}} compound {{m|zh|無形|tr=mju heng|lit=without shape}}. A combined reading, using the [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] for {{m|ja|無|tr=mu}} but the [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] for {{m|ja|形|tr=kei}}, so this reading likely represents a later development in Japan.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|むけい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むけい}}

# [[formlessness]], [[shapelessness]], [[invisibility]], [[intangibility]], [[incorporeality]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''無形'''の力、'''無形'''固定資産|'''むけい''' の ちから、 '''むけい''' こてい しさん|an '''invisible''' force, '''intangible''' fixed assets}}

=====Antonyms=====
* {{ja-r|有形|ゆうけい}}: [[tangible]], having a [[shape]] or [[form]]

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|無見|むけん}}: the belief that everything in this world is [[null]] and [[void]], without [[substance]]
